question: Serous Demilunes are present in large number in which gland
exp: Serous demilunes are cellular formations in the shape of a half-moon on some salivary glands. It is a feature of mixed (seromucinous)glands like submandibular salivary glands. Theseare the serous cells at the distal end of mucous tubuloalveolar secretory unit of ceain glands. Type of glands: Parotid - serous gland Sublingual (major)- mucinous gland Submandibular and Sublingual- mixed

question: The mammary gland is which type of gland?
Sweat glands are which types of gland:
exp: Sweat glands are simple coiled tubular glands. Ducts of sweat glands are lined by Stratified Cuboidal Epithelium.

question: Type of connective tissue present in the arrow marked area is
exp: The arrow mark shows the deep reticular layer of dermis, which is made up of dense and irregular connective tissue. Location Dense irregular: Capsule of visceral organs Periosteum, perichondrium Sheaths of nerves, muscles etc Dense regular Tendons, aponeurosis, ligament Deep fascial

question: Of the following cell types found in connective tissue, which is most often present along capillaries and resembles fibroblasts?
exp: Pericytes are pluripotential cells that resemble Fibroblasts, although they are smaller, and are adjacent to capillaries.
